result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Savon Quintrell Morris

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Savon Quintrell Morris appeared by video.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Savon Quintrell Morris.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Parties inform the court of a potential DPA and request a DPA hearing.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Savon Quintrell Morris appeared by video.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Savon Quintrell Morris.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Parties are still negotiating and request additional time for further discussions.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Court approves Zoom appearances at the next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Savon Quintrell Morris appeared by video.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Savon Quintrell Morris.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a scheduling conference.  TAD evaluation for potential Deferred Prosecution Agreement already conducted.  Parties are still negotiating.  Court scheduled a status conference.  Court approves Zoom appearances at the next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
at Defense request and with no objection from the State, scheduling conference moved from 09-13-2022 to 09-23-2022 at 1:30 pm

Defendant Savon Quintrell Morris in court, appear by video with attorney Theodore OReilly appear, by video for attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer B. Baker.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Savon Quintrell Morris in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Savon Quintrell Morris in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Savon Quintrell Morris not in court.  Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/09/2022@2:30pm
